title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.8.29 | 25-02-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: So Kunti is helping us understand what is the nature of Krishna's personality.
segments.summary: This segment introduces the verse from Srimad Bhagavatam being discussed and highlights Kunti's understanding of Krishna's transcendental nature and impartiality.

segments.key_quote: Krishna is not a human being. Krishna is the Supreme Unlimited Lord.
segments.summary: This segment elaborates on Krishna's transcendental nature, emphasizing that He is not a human being and is not influenced by material contamination, unlike conditioned souls.

segments.key_quote: Foolish people think that devotional service is something like flattering Krishna to get some special mercy.
segments.summary: This segment contrasts conditioned souls seeking material enjoyment with pure devotees offering selfless service, using the analogy of a mercantile community to illustrate the difference.

segments.key_quote: You simply want to serve Krishna out of love Krishna wants to provide you everything that you require out of love for you.
segments.summary: This segment emphasizes the importance of unconditional service to Krishna and the reciprocal relationship where Krishna provides everything out of love.

segments.key_quote: The mercy of the Supreme Lord Krishna is open for everyone all living beings especially all human beings but people are reluctant to receive the mercy of Krishna many times they refuse.
segments.summary: This segment discusses the availability of Krishna's mercy to all, contrasting pure and mixed devotees and highlighting the rarity of pure devotional service.

segments.key_quote: Those who are cent percent engaged in devotional service to Krishna are the full recipients of the Lord's mercy.
segments.summary: This segment explains who can receive Krishna's mercy, differentiating between those in darkness, partial recipients, and full recipients based on their engagement in devotional service.

segments.key_quote: It appears like he is partial to his devotees but he is not at all partial he is simply reciprocating with each person exactly according to that person surrender to Krishna that's all.
segments.summary: This segment concludes by emphasizing the availability of Krishna's mercy through sincere chanting, explaining that Krishna reciprocates based on surrender, and discussing salvation and the spiritual abode.
